intro: Gnidia psilotoides, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom from late winter to early spring. Its flowers are followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Gnidia psilotoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
